name: AEGON N.V.
bossPosition: Head of Government & Policy Affairs for Europe
membership:
Pan-European Insurance Forum (PEIF); Chief Risk Officers’ (CRO) and Chief Finance Officers’ (CFO) Forums; Geneva Association (GA); European Financial Services Roundtable (EFR), Insurance Europe, Verbond van Verzekeraars, Institute of International Finance (IIF) 
Companies of the AEGON  Group are also active in various national associations
goal:
Aegon provides insurance, pensions and asset management in more than 20 countries, serving millions of customers worldwide. Listed on the Amsterdam and New York stock exchanges, Aegon has A-level ratings from the three main credit rating agencies. Aegon has around 31,500 employees and manages more than EUR 550 billion of revenue-generating investments. Aegon’s main operations are in the United States, where it is one of the largest insurance companies, the Netherlands, where it is headquartered and ranks first in the Dutch group pensions market, and the United Kingdom where it has strong market positions in individual and group pensions. In Central and Eastern Europe, Aegon has businesses in seven countries: the Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Slovakia and is also active in Turkey and Ukraine. The company also has operations in Canada, Spain, France, Ireland, Hong Kong, China, India, Indonesia, Japan, Australia, Thailand, Singapore, Mexico and Brazil.
For more information, please see: http://www.aegon.com
interests: Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Taxation, Trade, Transport
